channel.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
channel.description:
hey guys i got some problems with saving my account at logging out..
im making an auto save but it doesnt work, im pretty new in coding and just want to learn from delta so dont blame on it.
every time i logout and in i come at the same place.. because it doesnt save my account.. look picture. any know how to fix it?
thanxxx

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Jabbascapeowner Jabbascapeowner
item.description:
@Jabbascapeowner wrote:

lol yes i am sure it wont work…

and i just added this at my actionbuttons

c.logout(); [b]c.write.savegame(true);[/b] break;

i hope it will work

EDIT: can i contact you via skype maybe
?

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Are you sure? because it has always worked for me.

Follow Steps

  1. LOG OFF THE ACCOUNT!
  2. Now go to characters and change the player rights
  3. log back in.

Remember not to save the notepad and then log off, because it saves that character back to 0 rights.

Hope you get what im saying.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Jabbascapeowner Jabbascapeowner
item.description:
@Jabbascapeowner wrote:

hmm i guess its only fucking up my coords…

DAn0194:

EDIT: When you use character files you dont have to turn your server off you have to log off the account your using change it and then log back in.

this isnt working…-.- i really have to turn off my server to change anything in my charachters files…

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Just for OP’s clarification.

“ActionButtons”
“ClickingMost”
“CommonClick”

All pretty much refer to the same class your Base has. Since It’s Delta, It’s probably named as ClickingMost.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Yep just change the 20000 in the code to something smaller, so say you want it to save every two secends, change 20000 to 2000.

The logout packet is in Clickingmost.java Look up 9154.

You can also see the void in the client.java by looking up: public void logout

Hope this helps.

EDIT: When you use character files you dont have to turn your server off you have to log off the account your using change it and then log back in.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Jabbascapeowner Jabbascapeowner
item.description:
@Jabbascapeowner wrote:

For now you can just do it manually via Character File. Set the "Rights" variable to 3.

this isnt working, i have to turn off my server, then i can change it and turn my server on…

It's because it only Saves every 20 Seconds with that.

its not working every 20 seconds…

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Jabbascapeowner:

its working, but not always…

It’s because it only Saves every 20 Seconds with that.

Jabbascapeowner:

and i can still dont change my player rights…

For now you can just do it manually via Character File. Set the “Rights” variable to 3.

Jabbascapeowner:

where can i find the shit of the logout button?

The “shit of the logout button”, lol. I believe you’re looking for Packet 9154 in your ActionButtons class.

@Dan: Not a problem.

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:5, topic:471996”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=589681.msg4176585#msg4176585 date=1355067030]
Add this in your boolean process and it will save automatically anywhere you go at 20 Second intervals provided the User isn’t in Trade.

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastSave > 20000 && !inTrade){ savegame(true); lastSave = System.currentTimeMillis(); }
[/quote][/quote]

Lol thanks for explaning it for me, I though he would know.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] account doesn't save
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Does your Client class feature this Method:

     public void logout() {
          resetfollowers();
          savegame(true);
          outStream.createFrame(109);
     }

Does your ActionButtons class call on that upon Button-Click? The I.D. is “9154”. Check your saveGame Statements as well.

Also, does your Delta Base have a cheap auto-save? Such as:

     if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastSave > 120000 ){
          savegame(false);
          lastSave = System.currentTimeMillis();
     }

That’s probably going to be in a Process.

P.S. Are you sure that it doesn’t save, or does it reset the Player-Character Coordinates upon Log?

Read full topic
